Articles.Content:
Hello everyone. I am new here. I have yet to try getting to the Mun. I am still following youtube channels. I think today I will take the plunge.

Anyway, I noticed that I like to refer to my computer calculator. I have also seen online calculators designed for Kerbal. My suggestion is that we have an in-game calculator we can access from any screen. Maybe in the future it could be specialized for easier calculations in Kerbal.

If you already have one, my apologies.
If you want just a normal calculator, you can play KSP windowed. Then you can use the system calculator or any internet tool without needing to have it implemented in the game.

On some systems, graphics performance is improved if playing non-windowed. Also, an in-game calculator would allow certain functions like grabbing the current vessel's fuel remaining, or other game values direct from the game.
What's wrong with a pocket calculator? Or the one on your phone? No need for new build-in features or swapping screens, just use what you already have.
